dict.string: The pass through the list is repeated until no swaps are needed, which indicates that the list is sorted.
First, "4" and "1" are compared. "4" is greater than "1"
Therefore, "4" is swapped with "1". Now, the number on the left is smaller than the number on the right
Now, we continue "bubbling" to the right and compare "4" with "9". This time "4" is smaller than "9", so the numbers don't get swapped.
Again, we "bubble" to the right and compare "9" with "2"
The number on the left, which is "9", is greater than the number on the right, which is "2". Therefore, the numbers get swapped.
Obviously, these numbers need to be swapped.
Now, we reach end of the list, "9" is in correct position
Next step, we come back to the front of the list and repeat the "bubbling" operation.
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
